Class StringLineWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.pl.io.StringLineWriter

  • public class StringLineWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows line-by-line manipulation of a string.
    Author:
    kprevas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StringLineWriter()
      Constructs a new, empty writer.
      StringLineWriter(java.lang.String source)
      Constructs a new writer from the contents of a string.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendLine(java.lang.Object contents)
      Appends a new line with the given contents.
      void appendToLine(int lineNumber, java.lang.Object contents)
      Appends some content to the end of a line.
      java.lang.String getLine(int lineNumber)
      Gets the contents of the line at the given line number.
      int getNumLines()
      Returns the number of lines.
      boolean hasChanged() 
      void insertLine(int lineNumber, java.lang.Object contents)
      Inserts a line with the given contents at the given index.
      void removeLine(int lineNumber)
      Removes a line.
      void setLine(int lineNumber, java.lang.Object contents)
      Replaces the contents of a line.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the contents, with lines separated by a newline character.
